post.summary: Get the Skill Cluster adoption report
post.description:
![Beta](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Experimental-orange)

Retrieve the Skill Cluster adoption report for all Employees with respect to the value of a Custom Property and one
or more Skill Clusters.

The report consists of three smaller reports. A heatmap, a Skill Cluster adoption report, and a Skill breakdown.

- The heatmap returns the adoption of each requested Skill Cluster for all Employees which have the same Custom
Property.
- The Skill Cluster adoption gives the proficiency level per requested Skill Cluster for each Employee.
- The Skill breakdown returns an overview of the Skills of the requested Skill Cluster for each Employee.

parameters.name: file_format
parameters.description: The output format in which the report will be returned. When `csv` is chosen, a ZIP file is returned containing the three reports in csv format.

requestBody.description: Filters for the Skill Cluster adoption report

group_by_custom_property.description: Group the output by this property.

relevant_skill_clusters.description: List of Skill Clusters used for the Skill Cluster adoption report.

post.summary: Get the replacement risk report
post.description:
![Beta](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Experimental-orange)

Retrieve the replacement risk report for all Employees with respect to the value of a Custom Property and one or more filters. The replacement risk report shows which Employees pose a risk in terms of finding a proper replacement, as well as the Skills that would be in danger should this Employee leave.

The report consists of three smaller reports. An aggregated replacement risk report, an aggregated Skills at risk report and an Employee replacement risk report.

- The aggregated replacement risk report returns the replacement risk distribution for every group. The distribution shows how high the risk is when replacing Employees with other Employees from the same group. A high replacement risk means that there is no other Employee within the same group that can replace a particular Employee.
- The aggregated Skills at risk report lists every endangered Skill for every group and how many times the Skill is present within the group. A Skill is only shows if fewer than six Employees within the same group have this Skill.
- The Employee risk report shows in detail for every Employee how high the replacement risk is and the Skills at risk for this Employee.

parameters.name: file_format
parameters.description: The output format in which the report will be returned. When `csv` is chosen, a ZIP file is returned containing four reports in csv format.

requestBody.description: Filters for the replacement risk report

group_by_custom_property.description: Group the output by this property.

filters.description: List of filters used for the replacement risk report.

post.summary: Get the succession risk report
post.description:
![Beta](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Experimental-orange)

Retrieve the succession risk report for all Employees with respect to their manager and one or more filters. The succession risk report shows which managers do not have a successor ready within their team and which Skills potential successors are missing the most.

parameters.name: file_format
parameters.description: The output format in which the report will be returned. When `csv` is chosen, a ZIP file is returned containing two files in csv format which represent the report.

requestBody.description: Managers and filters for the succession risk report

manager_id.description: The unique ID of the manager in your system, consisting of alphanumeric characters, hyphens and underscores.

employee_filters.description: List of filters used to group the Employees per manager.

filters.description: List of additional filters used for the succession risk report, applied on every selected team.

post.summary: Get the Skill inventory report
post.description:
![Beta](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Experimental-orange)

Get your Skill inventory, the Skill Clusters of your entities, and where these originate from.
This report generates a zip file containing the following files:
- `dim_{entity_type}.csv` : A list of all entities in the system, containing external IDs and Custom Properties provided in `entity_columns`.
- `fact_{entity_type}_property.csv` : A list of Custom Property mappings containing external IDs of the entity, Custom Property name and Custom Property value for all the Custom Properties provided in `entity_properties`.
- `dim_skill.csv` : A list of all Skills referred to in the files above containing the external IDs, the name and the description.
- `dim_skill_cluster.csv` : A list of all Skill Clusters in the system, containing the name, the Domain name and their Skills.
- `fact_{entity_type}_skill_cluster.csv` : A list of the validation state and proficiency level for each combination of Employee and Skill Cluster.
- `fact_skill_cluster.csv` : A list of all Skills in each Skill Cluster, containing the Skill Cluster external IDs and Skill external IDs.
- `fact_skill_source.csv` : A list containing the source of each Skill of an Employee.

requestBody.description: Filters for the Skill inventory report.

entity_type.description: Name of the entity type for which the report will be generated.

entity_columns.description: The Custom Property columns that will be included in the `dim_{entity}.csv` file. This can be an empty list.

entity_properties.description: The Custom Properties that will be included in the `fact_{entity}_properties.csv` file. This can be an empty list.

post.summary: Get the internal talent mobility report.
post.description:
![Beta](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Experimental-orange)

This report generates a zip file containing the following files:
- `dim_employee.csv` : A list of all Employees in the system, containing their external IDs and Custom Properties provided in `employee_columns`.
- `fact_employee_property.csv` : A list of Custom Property mappings containing external IDs of the Employee, Custom Property name and Custom Property value for all the Custom Properties provided in `employee_properties`.
- `dim_vacancy.csv` : A list of all Vacancies in the system, containing external IDs and Custom Properties provided in `vacancy_columns`.
- `fact_vacancy_property.csv` : A list of Custom Property mappings containing external IDs of the Vacancy, Custom Property name and Custom Property value for all Custom Properties provided in `vacancy_properties`.
- `fact_vacancy_skill.csv` : Contains a list of all Vacancy external ID-Skill pairs.
- `fact_match_skill.csv` : Contains the match score for every Skill for all Employee-Vacancy pairs.
- `dim_skill.csv` : A list of all Skills referred to in the files above containing the external IDs, the name and the description.
- `fact_match.csv` : Contains the match score of all Employee-Vacancy pairs.

requestBody.description: Filters for the Skill inventory report.

max_employees_per_vacancy.description: The max number of Employees that will be matched for each Vacancy.

employee_columns.description: The Custom Property columns that will be included in the `dim_employee.csv` file.

employee_properties.description: The Custom Properties that will be included in the `fact_employee_properties.csv` file.

vacancy_columns.description: The Custom Property columns that will be included in the `dim_vacancy.csv` file.

vacancy_properties.description: The Custom Properties that will be included in the `fact_vacancy_property.csv` file.

post.summary: Get the Job Architecture benchmark report
post.description:
![Beta](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Experimental-orange)

Get your Job Architecture Benchmark containing the Jobs and how they compare to the ones in their peer groups.
This report generates a zip file containing the following files:
- `dim_peer_group.csv`: A list of all Jobs in the system, containing external IDs and the ID of the peer group.
- `fact_peer_group_property.csv`: Currently unused.
- `dim_job.csv`: A list of all Jobs present in the system, containing their external IDs, Job titles and Custom Properties provided in `job_columns`.
- `fact_job_property.csv`: A list of Custom Property mappings containing external IDs of the Job, Custom Property name and Custom Property value for all Custom Properties provided in `job_properties`.
- `dim_skill.csv`: A list of all Skills referred to in the files above containing the external IDs, the name and the description.
- `fact_match_skill.csv`: Contains the match score for every Skill for all peer group - Job pairs.
- `fact_match.csv`: Contains the match score of all peer group - Job pairs.

requestBody.description: Options for the Job Architecture benchmark report.

job_columns.description: The Custom Property columns that will be included in the `dim_job.csv` file.

job_properties.description: The Custom Properties that will be included in the `fact_job_property.csv` file.

peer_group_columns.description: The Custom Property columns that will be included in the `dim_peer_group.csv` file. **Currently has no effect!**

peer_group_properties.description: The Custom Properties that will be included in the `fact_peer_group_property.csv` file. **Currently has no effect!**

get.description: Get the current version of the API for your tenant.

EntityLimit.name: limit
EntityLimit.description: The maximal number of entities returned, ordered by the `last_updated` field and `external_id`.

EntityOffset.name: offset
EntityOffset.description: The applied offset for returned entities, results starting from `offset` up to `offset + limit`.

IsActive.name: is_active
IsActive.description: This parameter can be used to only include entities with the `active` attribute set to `true` or `false`. If the parameter is not set, all entities will be included.

OrganisationalUnitFilter.name: organisational_unit
OrganisationalUnitFilter.description: This parameter can be used to only include Employees linked to the specified `organisational_unit`. If `organisational_unit="null"`, only Employees without a linked Organisatioanl Unit are included. If the parameter is not set, all entities will be included.

ExtractionLanguage.name: language
ExtractionLanguage.description: The language of the input data, which has an impact on the Skill extraction. `auto` will automatically detect the language used in the provided data.

Strict.name: strict
Strict.description: If strict is enabled, entity creation will fail when a Skill Profile cannot be constructed. If strict is set to false, failed Skill Profile creation will still result in entity creation, but the Skill Profile will be empty.

AttributeInclude.name: include
AttributeInclude.description: Additional entity attributes that will be included in the response body. This query parameter can be added multiple times to include more attributes.

EmployeeResponseFormat.name: response_format
EmployeeResponseFormat.description:
The format of the response profile.
More info about adding your Skill Clusters can be found in the <u>[tutorials](https://developers.techwolf.ai/tutorials/skill-clusters/skill-cluster-framework/)</u>.

VocabLanguage.name: vocab_language
VocabLanguage.description: The display language used for Skill names. Altering the vocabulary language does **not** change the Skill Profile; it solely changes the way it is displayed. If not specified, the default language (`en_uk`) will be used. The `en` language is an alias for `en_uk`.

EmployeeProfileInclude.name: include
EmployeeProfileInclude.description: Additional entity attributes that will be included in the response body. This parameter has no effect when `response_format` is set to `domains`.

ExternalVendor.name: external_vendor
ExternalVendor.description: The external vendor language you want to see the Skills displayed in. This will only work for vendors that are activated on your tenant.

ResponseFormat.name: response_format
ResponseFormat.description: The format of the response profile.

ParentIDFilter.name: parent_id
ParentIDFilter.description: This parameter can be used to only include Organisational Units with the specified `parent_id` as their direct parent. If `parent_id="null"`, only root Organisational Units are included. If the parameter is not set, all entities will be included.

DesiredFunctionsRequestFormat.name: request_format
DesiredFunctionsRequestFormat.description:
Explicitly sets the input format used to represent the submitted desired functions as either:
  * a structured list of Job title objects.
  * free-text multiline string input in which each line contains at most one Job title.

NaceType.name: type
NaceType.description: As European member states are free to deepen the baselist of NACE codes to classify economic activities, this parameter specifies the derivative set of NACE codes used as input. For example, NACE**BEL**-codes are standard use in Belgium.

DomainNamespace.name: domain_namespace
DomainNamespace.description: The Domain namespace determines the Domains the Skills will be mapped to. Skills are mapped to the Skill Domains of TechWolf by default. Choosing the `taxonomy` Domain namespace maps the Skills to the Skill Cluster Domains in your Taxonomy.

EmployeeExternalId.name: employee_external_id
EmployeeExternalId.description: Unique external ID linked to this Employee, consisting of alphanumeric characters, hyphens and underscores.

VacancyExternalId.name: vacancy_external_id
VacancyExternalId.description: Unique external ID linked to this Vacancy, consisting of alphanumeric characters, hyphens and underscores.

ScoreMinThreshold.name: score_min_threshold
ScoreMinThreshold.description: The minimum score of the results. Due to approximations for fast result-delivery, there might be records with a score slightly lower than the minimum.

MatchLimit.name: limit
MatchLimit.description: The maximal number of results returned.

MatchOffset.name: offset
MatchOffset.description: The rank offset for returned matches, return matches starting from rank offset up to rank offset+limit.

ResponseFormatMatching.name: response_format
ResponseFormatMatching.description: If set to `explained`, the response will include an explanation of the match.

ResponseFormatRecommendation.name: response_format
ResponseFormatRecommendation.description: If set to `explained`, the response will include an explanation of the recommendation.

JobExternalId.name: job_external_id

weight.description: The geo distance weight will apply a matching boost to entities withing close proximity of each other. Between the `full_score_distance` and `zero_score_distance`, the boost value linearly decreases. If the distance is shorter than `full_score_distance`, the full boost is applied, while any distance bigger than `zero_score_distance` will result in a zero boost.

full_score_distance.description: The distance (in km) to where the boosting is fully applied.

zero_score_distance.description: The distance (in km) from where no boosting will be applied.

weight.description: The language weight will apply a matching boost to entities with similar language levels. How similar the language levels must be for boosting, can be determined using the `max_overqualification` and `max_underqualification` parameters.

max_overqualification.description: The amount of language levels that the entity may be above the required level.

max_underqualification.description: The amount of language levels that the entity may be below the required level. If `level - max_underqualification <= 0` all entities with a lower language level receive a boost.

weight.description: The Custom Property weight applies the specified score boosting effect (`value`) to all the entities for which the given Custom Property match the condition `property_name` `operator` `property_value`

property_name.description: Name of the Custom Property used for score boosting. List properties are not supported. If the entity does not have this property, the score boosting does not apply to the matching score of this entity.

operator.description:
The type of comparison to apply between the `property_value` and the Custom Properties' value. The following operators are supported per property type:
  * `text`: `lt`, `lte`, `eq`, `gte`, `gt`
  * `number`: `lt`, `lte`, `eq`, `gte`, `gt`
  * `boolean`: `eq`
  * `datetime`: `lt`, `lte`, `eq`, `gte`, `gt`

property_value.description: Value used in the comparison to the Custom Properties' value.

weight.description: The Custom Property is in weight applies the specified score boosting effect (`value`) to all the entities for which the `list[text]` Custom Property contains the `text` Custom Property of the entity for which you're calculating matches.

from_entity_property.description: Property name of the property for the entity for which you're calculating matches. Should be a `text` Custom Property. If the entity does not have this property, no score boost is applied.

to_entity_property.description: Property name of the property of the entities that are possible match results. Must be a `list[text]` Custom Property. If the entity does not have this property, no score boost is applied.

weight.description: The Custom Property is in list weight applies the specified score boosting effect (`value`) to all the entities for which a Custom Property is contained in a list of given values.

property_name.description: Name of the Custom Property used for boosting.

possible_values.description: List of allowed values for the Custom Property. No score boosting is applied to all entities with a value for the specified Custom Property that is not in this list.

weight.description: The Custom Property contains weight applies the specified score boosting effect (`value`) to all the entities for which the value of their `text` Custom Property is contained in the `list[text]` Custom Property of the entity for which you're calculating matches.

from_entity_property.description: Property name of the property for the entity for which you're calculating matches. Must be a `list[text]` Custom Property. If the entity does not have this property, no score boost is applied.

to_entity_property.description: Property name of the property of the entities that are possible match results. Should be a `text` Custom Property. If the entity does not have this property, no score boost is applied.

weight.description: The Custom Property contains element weight applies the specified score boosting effect (`value`) to all the entities for which the values list of a Custom Property contains a given value.

property_name.description: Name of the Custom Property used for boosting. Should be a `list[text]` Custom Property.

oneOf.description: Property value that should be present in the values list of the Custom Property. No score boosting is applied to all entities with a list not containing this value.

items.description: List of property values. One of these values should be present in the values list of the Custom Property. No score boosting is applied to all entities with a list not containing any of these values.

weight.description: The Custom Property list overlap weight applies the specified score boosting effect (`value`) to all the entities for which the given Custom Properties of type `list[text]` have at least one item in common.

from_entity_property.description: The name of a `list[text]` property of the entity to find matches for. If the entity does not have this property, no weight is applied.

to_entity_property.description: The name of a `list[text]` property of the matching entities. The weight is not applied if matches do not have this Custom Property.

The Skill "Screening Resumes" requires one to be able to quickly and effectively screen resumes in order to identify qualified candidates for a position.

Unit Testing is a software testing method in which individual units of source code, sets of one or more computer program modules together with associated control data, usage procedures, and operating procedures, are tested to determine whether they are fit for use. The Skill "Unit Testing" requires the ability to create and run tests on individual components of a software system to ensure they are functioning correctly.

example.course_description: Programming is an increasingly important Skill, whether you aspire to a career in software development, or in other fields. This Course is the first in the specialization Introduction to Programming in C, but its lessons extend to any language you might want to learn. This is because programming is fundamentally about figuring out how to solve a class of problems and writing the algorithm, a clear set of steps to solve any problem in its class. This Course will introduce you to a powerful problem-solving process—the Seven Steps—which you can use to solve any programming problem. In this Course, you will learn how to develop an algorithm, then progress to reading code and understanding how programming concepts relate to algorithms.

From research to optimization, Product Marketing Core explores (cliche alert!) the A to Z of product marketing, and with PMMC in your pocket, you’ll have a richer understanding of the what, why, and how of every product marketing principle. And that’s a promise.

You will analyze both road networks and social networks and will learn how to compute the shortest route between New York and San Francisco (1000 times faster than the standard shortest path algorithms!) Afterwards, you will learn how to assemble genomes from millions of short fragments of DNA and how assembly algorithms fuel recent developments in personalized medicine.
